result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas J. Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant shall pay the costs at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning March 17, 2017.

Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Douglas J. Allen in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest to count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty to Count 1.  Court dismisses and read in count 2.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  The costs are to be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning March 17, 2017.  - rt

Defendant Douglas J. Allen in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Nocco states that no motions to be heard and agreement has been reached.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2017 at 02:15 pm. ba
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 14, 2017 at 02:15 pm.
Motion hearing on December 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Douglas J. Allen in court with attorney Nocco appearing specially.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant contacted public defender's office and is eligible for public defender.  Attorney Nocco waives the reading of the complaint, charges and penalties.  Attorney Nocco enters a plea of not guilty on all charges.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 02:45 pm.  - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with the booking procedures. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.
Initial Appearance on August 23, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.
Arrest Report

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $500.00 signature bond with conditions of: booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Court orders clerk to begin bond revocation on 16CM62. Initial appearance set for August 23, 2016 at 1:00 p.m. ba
